name: Lydford Gorge Waterfall trail, Lydford Gorge

ai.summary: An easy 3.4 km hike along Lydford Gorge to the scenic waterfall. The trail features gentle paths, boardwalk sections, and river views, making it suitable for families and most hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: Combination of level paths, wooden boardwalks, and some rocky or muddy sections. There are steps near the waterfall and surfaces can be damp or slippery, especially after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy, waterproof footwear with good grip; stay on marked paths and avoid edges; be cautious on wet boardwalks and steps; check weather and flood risk before visiting; supervise children at all times and plan for limited mobility by choosing accessible viewpoints.
recommended_gear: Phone with emergency numbers and fully charged battery
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn generally offer the best conditions and lighting; winter visits can be windy, muddy, and have shorter daylight.
